Standard class specifications

Source: R/class-spec.R
as_class.Rd

This is used as the interface between R7 and R's other OO systems, allowing you to use R7 classes and methods with base types, informal S3 classes, and formal S4 classes.

as_class(x, arg = deparse(substitute(x)))

Arguments

x

A class specification. One of the following:

  • An R7 class (created by new_class()).

  • An R7 union (created by new_union()).

  • An S3 class (created by s3_class()).

  • An S4 class (created by methods::getClass() or methods::new()).

  • A base type specified either with its constructor (logical, integer, double etc) or its name ("logical", "integer", "double" etc).

  • A base union type specified by its name: "numeric", "atomic", or "vector".

arg

Argument name used when generating errors.

Value

A standardised class: either NULL, an R7 class, an R7 union, as s3_class, or a S4 class.

Contents

Developed by Henrik Bengtsson, Will Landau, Michael Lawrence, Martin Maechler, Luke Tierney, Gabriela De Queiroz, Hadley Wickham, Jim Hester.
